Name: Flight 1862
Ingredients: 50 ml Bacardi Carta Blanca Superior White Rum
30 ml Egg white (pasteurised) or 																																			Aquafaba (chickpea water)																								 or 3 dashes Fee Brothers Fee Foam cocktail foamer
10 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: SHAKE all ingredients with ice and fine strain into chilled glass. *Special ingredient #1 : Port wine & sweet vermouth reduction made with 3 parts port wine and 1 part sweet vermouth, cook for 12 minutes on an induction hob or 18 minutes on a conventional hob with 2 cinnamon sticks.
History: Created for Bacardí Legacy 2017 by Sandro Pimenta at Farol Hotel, Cascais, Portugal. Inspiration : "The name Flight 1862 has a very special meaning because it represents firstly the 'flight' of Don Facundo Bacardí when he left Spain at the age of fifteen and travelled to Cuba, and also the year of the foundation of the Bacardi company, responsible for so many of the classic cocktails."
Nutrition: One serving of Flight 1862 contains 154 calories
Garnish: Black pepper, orange zest twist, maraschino cherry & paper aeroplane
